title: rtabulator
text: render table just pass data frame tabulator(): case, column definitions automatically created . horizontal alignment character columns set left numeric columns aligned right. also possible pass data URL:
code: tabulator(airquality) data_url <- "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/eodaGmbH/rtabulator/main/data-raw/titanic.csv"  tabulator(   data_url,   col_select = c("PassengerId", "Name", "Pclass", "Fare", "Survived") )

title: rtabulator
code: setup <- tabulator_options(   row_height = 50,   selectable_rows = FALSE,   edit_trigger_event = "click" )  tabulator(iris, setup, editable = TRUE)

title: rtabulator
text: Note prefer pipe style, can also use helper function set_options_pagination().
code: setup <- tabulator_options(   pagination = TRUE,   pagination_size = 10,   pagination_size_selector = c(10, 20, 50) )  tabulator(USArrests, setup)

title: rtabulator
text: customize columns, easiest way use set_formatter_*() functions: for_each_col() can apply formatter function updates column settings multiple columns:
code: tabulator(airquality) |>   set_formatter_progress("Temp", legend = TRUE, legend_align = "left") |>   set_formatter_traffic_light("Ozone") |>   set_tooltip("Ozone") numeric_cols <- c("Sepal_Length", "Sepal_Width", "Petal_Length", "Petal_Width")  tabulator(iris) |>   for_each_col(     numeric_cols,     set_formatter_progress,     legend = TRUE,     legend_align = "left",     min = 0,     max = 10,     color = c("yellow", "orange", "green")   ) |>   for_each_col(numeric_cols, set_tooltip)

title: rtabulator
text: can create multi column headers set_multi_column_header(): Note functions update column definitions, set_multi_column_header() must last one. Therefore, example set_header_filter() called set multi column header.
code: headers <- list(   Sepal = c("Sepal_Width", "Sepal_Length"),   Petal = c("Petal_Width", "Petal_Length") )  tabulator(iris) |>   set_header_filter("Species", "list", placeholder = "Select Species") |>   set_multi_column_header(headers)

title: rtabulator
text: Multi level grouping done passing vector group_by parameter: Note can also use set_options_group_by() set group options.
code: setup <- tabulator_options(   group_by = c("Pclass"),   group_start_open = FALSE,   group_toggle_element = "header" )  titanic_df <- titanic(c("Pclass", "Sex", "Age", "Survived"))  tabulator(titanic_df, setup) |>   set_formatter_traffic_light("Survived", color = c("red", "green")) setup <- tabulator_options(   group_by = c("Sex", "Pclass"),   group_start_open = c(TRUE, FALSE) )  tabulator(titanic_df, setup)

title: rtabulator
text: set_calculation() can add calculations top bottom columns:
code: tabulator(iris[4:5]) |>   set_calculation("Petal_Width", "avg", pos = "top") |>   set_calculation("Petal_Width", "max", precision = 1, pos = "bottom")

title: rtabulator
text: Set editable = TRUE make columns table editable. case, editor numeric columns set number others input. customize editor settings validate user input use set_editor():
code: setup <- tabulator_options(edit_trigger_event = "click")  tabulator(iris, setup, editable = TRUE) tabulator(iris[, c(2, 5)], setup) |>   set_editor(     column = "Species",     editor = "list",     values_lookup = "active",     clearable = TRUE,     autocomplete = TRUE   ) |>   set_editor(     column = "Sepal_Width",     editor = "number",     min = 0,     max = 10,     step = 0.1,     validator = c("min:0", "max:10")   )

title: rtabulator
text: create empty spreadsheet just pass empty list data parameter spreadsheet = TRUE tabulator(): data format spreadsheets list lists vectors entry represents row spreadsheet: use multiple sheets pass list sheets created withspreadsheet_def(). case, data passed data parameter sheet definitions:
code: tabulator(data = list(), spreadsheet = TRUE) spreadsheet_data <- list(   c(1, 2, 3),   c(2, 3, 4) ) sheets <- list(   spreadsheet_def(title = "Lee", data = spreadsheet_data),   spreadsheet_def(title = "Morgan", data = list()) # Empty spreadsheet ) setup <- tabulator_options(   spreadsheet = TRUE,   spreadsheet_sheets = sheets,   spreadsheet_sheet_tabs = TRUE,   edit_trigger_event = "click" )  tabulator(NULL, setup)

title: rtabulator
text: Shiny integration: vignette("shiny") Themes: vignette("themes") Connecting tables: vignette("connected-tables")

title: Shiny integration
text: Use tabulatorOutput() UI renderTabulator() server part Shiny application:
code: ui <- fluidPage(   titlePanel("Titanic Data Set"),   tabulatorOutput("titanic") )  server <- function(input, output) {   output$titanic <- renderTabulator({     tabulator(titanic()) |>       set_formatter_progress("Fare") |>       set_tooltip("Fare") |>       set_formatter_tick_cross("Survived") |>       set_formatter_star("Pclass", number_of_stars = 3)   }) }  shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)

title: Shiny integration
text: Triggers trigger_download() trigger_get_data() trigger_get_sheet_data() undo() redo() add_row() delete_row() delete_selected_rows() Events {OUTPUT_ID}_row_clicked {OUTPUT_ID}_rows_selected {OUTPUT_ID}_data_filtered {OUTPUT_ID}_cell_edited {OUTPUT_ID}_data: Must triggered trigger_get_data() {OUTPUT_ID}_sheet_data: Must triggered trigger_get_sheet_data() Use tabulatorContext() conjunction trigger functions: Run example :
code: library(shiny)  OUTPUT_ID <- "titanic"  data <- titanic(c("PassengerId", "Pclass", "Survived", "Fare")) setup <- tabulator_options(   selectable_rows = TRUE,   edit_trigger_event = "focus" )  ui <- fluidPage(   titlePanel("Titanic Data"),   tabulatorOutput(OUTPUT_ID),   actionButton("download", "Download"),   actionButton("submit", "Submit data to R") )  server <- function(input, output) {   output$titanic <- renderTabulator({     tabulator(data, setup, editable = TRUE) |>       set_header_filter("Pclass", "list") |>       set_header_filter("Survived", "list") |>       set_header_filter("Fare", "number", "<=", clearable = TRUE) |>       set_options_pagination() |>       set_formatter_money(         "Fare",         symbol = "\U00A3",         symbol_after = FALSE,         precision = 1,         hoz_align = "right"       ) |>       set_tooltip("Fare") |>       set_formatter_tick_cross("Survived") |>       set_formatter_star("Pclass", number_of_stars = 3)   })    observeEvent(input$download, {     tabulatorContext(OUTPUT_ID) |>       trigger_download("csv")   })    observeEvent(input$titanic_row_clicked, {     print("row_clicked")     print(input$titanic_row_clicked)   })    observeEvent(input$titanic_rows_selected, {     print("rows_selected")     print(input$titanic_rows_selected)   })    observeEvent(input$titanic_cell_edited, {     print("cell_edited")     print(input$titanic_cell_edited)   })    observeEvent(input$titanic_data_filtered, {     print("data_filtered")     print(head(input$titanic_data_filtered))   })    observeEvent(input$submit, {     print("Trigger get data")     tabulatorContext(OUTPUT_ID) |>       trigger_get_data()   })    observeEvent(input$titanic_get_data, {     print("Got data. Thanx!")     print(head(input$titanic_get_data))   }) }  shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server) shiny::runGitHub("eodaGmbH/rtabulator", subdir = "examples/shiny/titanic")

title: Themes
text: bootstrap3 bootstrap4 bootstrap5 bulma materialize semanticui Themes selected specifying theme parameter calling tabulator():
code: tabulator(iris, theme = "midnight")

title: R Bindings for Tabulator JS
text: goal rtabulator make breeze creating beautiful interactive tables markdown documents Shiny application using Tabulator JS.

title: R Bindings for Tabulator JS
text: Filtering Grouping Editing Input validation History undo redo actions Pagination Layout Column formatters Column calculations Multi column headers Packaged themes Spreadsheets supporting multiple sheets Download data Freeze data learn rtabulator, see documentation https://eodagmbh.github.io/rtabulator/. Bindings Python available https://github.com/eodaGmbH/py-tabulator.

title: R Bindings for Tabulator JS
text: can install released version rtabulator CRAN : can install development version rtabulator like :
code: install.packages("rtabulator") remotes::install_github("eodaGmbH/rtabulator")

title: R Bindings for Tabulator JS
code: library(rtabulator)  tabulator(mtcars)  # Set theme tabulator(iris, theme = "midnight")  # Format columns tabulator(airquality) |>   set_formatter_progress(     column = "Temp",     legend = TRUE,     legend_align = "left"   )  # Spreadsheet mode tabulator(data = list(), spreadsheet = TRUE)

title: R Bindings for Tabulator JS
code: shiny::runGitHub("eodaGmbH/rtabulator", subdir = "examples/shiny/titanic")

title: Apply a column setter function to multiple columns — for_each_col
code: for_each_col(widget, columns = NULL, .f, ...)

title: Apply a column setter function to multiple columns — for_each_col
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. columns (character vector): columns column setter function (.f) applied . set NULL,  applied columns. .f (function): column setter function updates column settings. ... Arguments passed .f.

Apply a column setter function to multiple columns — for_each_col
Redo changes — redo
code: redo(ctx)

title: Shiny bindings for rtabulator — rtabulator-shiny
text: Output render functions using rtabulator within Shiny applications interactive Rmd documents.

title: Shiny bindings for rtabulator — rtabulator-shiny
code: tabulatorOutput(outputId, width = "100%", height = "400px")  renderTabulator(expr, env = parent.frame(), quoted = FALSE)

title: Shiny bindings for rtabulator — rtabulator-shiny
text: outputId output variable read width, height Must valid CSS unit (like '100%', '400px', 'auto') number, coerced string 'px' appended. expr expression generates rtabulator env environment evaluate expr. quoted expr quoted expression (quote())? useful want save expression variable.

title: Set calculation — set_calculation
code: set_calculation(   widget,   column,   func = c("avg", "max", "min", "sum", "count", "unique"),   precision = 2,   pos = c("top", "bottom") )

title: Set calculation — set_calculation
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column (character): column func applied . func (character): calculation function applied values column. precision (integer)  number decimals display. Set FALSE display decimals. pos (character): Position calculated values displayed.

title: Set column defaults — set_column_defaults
code: set_column_defaults(   widget,   editor = FALSE,   header_filter = FALSE,   header_sort = TRUE,   tooltip = TRUE,   width = NULL,   ... )

title: Set column defaults — set_column_defaults
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. editor (character, bool): One "input" "number". set FALSE cells editable. header_filter (character, bool): One "input" "number". Set FALSE disable header filters. header_sort (bool): Whether enable header sorting. tooltip (bool): Whether show tooltips displaying cell value. width (integer): Fixed width columns. ... Additional settings.

title: Set editor — set_editor
code: set_editor(   widget,   column,   editor = c("input", "textarea", "number", "range", "tickCross", "star", "progress",     "date", "time", "datetime", "list"),   validator = NULL,   ... )

title: Set editor — set_editor
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column name column formatter applied . editor (character): editor type. validator (character vector): One validators validate user input. ... Optional editor parameters depending selected editor.

title: Set editor — set_editor
code: setup <- tabulator_options(edit_trigger_event = "click")  tabulator(iris[, c(2, 5)], setup) |>   set_editor(     column = "Species",     editor = "list",     values_lookup = "active",     clearable = TRUE,     autocomplete = TRUE   ) |>   set_editor(     column = "Sepal_Width",     editor = "number",     min = 0,     max = 10,     step = 0.1,     validator = c("min:0", "max:10")   ) title: Set color formatter — set_formatter_color
code: set_formatter_color(widget, column)

title: Set color formatter — set_formatter_color
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column name column formatter applied .

title: Set color formatter — set_formatter_color
code: data <- data.frame(   Label = c("R", "G", "B"),   Color = c("red", "green", "blue") )  tabulator(data, width = 200) |>   set_formatter_color("Color")  {"x":{"data":{"Label":["R","G","B"],"Color":["red","green","blue"],"id":[1,2,3]},"options":{"height":"311px","history":false,"layout":"fitColumns","responsiveLayout":false,"movableColumns":false,"headerVisible":true,"addRowPos":"bottom","movableRows":false,"resizableRows":false,"index":"id","groupStartOpen":true,"editTriggerEvent":"dblclick","selectableRows":"highlight","pagination":false,"paginationSize":10,"paginationSizeSelector":false,"paginationAddRow":"page","spreadsheet":false,"columns":[{"title":"Label","field":"Label","hozAlign":"left"},{"title":"Color","field":"Color","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"color"}]},"stylesheetText":null},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

title: Set datetime formatter — set_formatter_datetime
code: set_formatter_datetime(   widget,   column,   input_format = "yyyy-MM-dd hh:ss:mm",   output_format = "yy/MM/dd",   invalid_placeholder = "(invalid datetime)",   timezone = NA,   hoz_align = "left" )

title: Set datetime formatter — set_formatter_datetime
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column name column formatter applied . input_format (character): datetime input format. output_format (character): datetime output format. invalid_placeholder (character): value displayed invalid datetime provided. timezone (character): timezone datetime. hoz_align (character): horizontal alignment column.

title: Set datetime formatter — set_formatter_datetime
text: use formatter, need include luxon HTML dependency tabulator(..., luxon = TRUE).

title: Set datetime formatter — set_formatter_datetime
code: data <- data.frame(   Person = c("Franz", "Ferdinand"),   Birthday = c(     "2024-12-06 22:00:10",     "2023-06-07 14:12:45"   ) )  tabulator(data, luxon = TRUE) |>   set_formatter_datetime("Birthday", output_format = "dd.MM.yyyy")  {"x":{"data":{"Person":["Franz","Ferdinand"],"Birthday":["2024-12-06 22:00:10","2023-06-07 14:12:45"],"id":[1,2]},"options":{"height":"311px","history":false,"layout":"fitColumns","responsiveLayout":false,"movableColumns":false,"headerVisible":true,"addRowPos":"bottom","movableRows":false,"resizableRows":false,"index":"id","groupStartOpen":true,"editTriggerEvent":"dblclick","selectableRows":"highlight","pagination":false,"paginationSize":10,"paginationSizeSelector":false,"paginationAddRow":"page","spreadsheet":false,"columns":[{"title":"Person","field":"Person","hozAlign":"left"},{"title":"Birthday","field":"Birthday","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"datetime","formatterParams":{"inputFormat":"yyyy-MM-dd hh:ss:mm","outputFormat":"dd.MM.yyyy","invalidPlaceholder":"(invalid datetime)","timezone":null}}]},"stylesheetText":null},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

title: Set HTML formatter — set_formatter_html
code: set_formatter_html(widget, column, hoz_align = c("left", "center", "right"))

title: Set HTML formatter — set_formatter_html
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column name column formatter applied . hoz_align (character): horizontal alignment column.

title: Set HTML formatter — set_formatter_html
code: data <- data.frame( id = c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7), text_style = c( "Italic", "Bold", "Green", "Deleted", "Small", "H2O", "x2" ) ) tabulator(data, width = 400) |> set_formatter_html("text_style") {"x":{"data":{"id":[1,2,3,4,5,6,7],"text_style":["Italic<\/i>","Bold<\/b>","Green<\/span>","Deleted<\/del>","Small<\/small>","H2<\/sub>O","x2<\/sup>"]},"options":{"height":"311px","history":false,"layout":"fitColumns","responsiveLayout":false,"movableColumns":false,"headerVisible":true,"addRowPos":"bottom","movableRows":false,"resizableRows":false,"index":"id","groupStartOpen":true,"editTriggerEvent":"dblclick","selectableRows":"highlight","pagination":false,"paginationSize":10,"paginationSizeSelector":false,"paginationAddRow":"page","spreadsheet":false,"columns":[{"title":"id","field":"id","hozAlign":"right"},{"title":"text_style","field":"text_style","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"html"}]},"stylesheetText":null},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

title: Set image formatter — set_formatter_image
code: set_formatter_image(   widget,   column,   height = "50px",   width = "50px",   url_prefix = NULL,   url_suffix = NULL,   hoz_align = "center" )

title: Set image formatter — set_formatter_image
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column name column formatter applied . height (character): CSS value height image. width (character): CSS value width image. url_prefix (character): String add start cell value generating image src url. url_suffix (character): String add end cell value generating image src url. hoz_align (character): horizontal alignment column.

title: Set image formatter — set_formatter_image
code: image_url <- "https://picsum.photos/id/" image_size <- 100  image_data <- data.frame(   image = c(88, 98, 102, 201),   label = c("Pic No. 88", "Pic No. 98", "Pic No. 102", "Pic No 201") )  tabulator(image_data, tabulator_options(height = "400px")) |>   set_formatter_image(     "image",     height = image_size,     width = image_size,     url_prefix = image_url,     url_suffix = glue::glue("/{image_size}"),     hoz_align = "left"   )  {"x":{"data":{"image":[88,98,102,201],"label":["Pic No. 88","Pic No. 98","Pic No. 102","Pic No 201"],"id":[1,2,3,4]},"options":{"height":"400px","history":false,"layout":"fitColumns","responsiveLayout":false,"movableColumns":false,"headerVisible":true,"addRowPos":"bottom","movableRows":false,"resizableRows":false,"index":"id","groupStartOpen":true,"editTriggerEvent":"dblclick","selectableRows":"highlight","pagination":false,"paginationSize":10,"paginationSizeSelector":false,"paginationAddRow":"page","spreadsheet":false,"columns":[{"title":"image","field":"image","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"image","formatterParams":{"height":100,"width":100,"urlPrefix":"https://picsum.photos/id/","urlSuffix":"/100"}},{"title":"label","field":"label","hozAlign":"left"}]},"stylesheetText":null},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

title: Set link formatter — set_formatter_link
code: set_formatter_link(   widget,   column,   label_field = NULL,   url_prefix = NULL,   url = NULL,   target = "_blank",   hoz_align = "left" )

title: Set link formatter — set_formatter_link
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column name column formatter applied . label_field (character): Column used label link. url_prefix (character): Prefix add URL value. url (JavaScript function): JavaScript function return URL value. cell passed function first argument. Use JS pass JS code. target (character): Target attribute anchor tag. hoz_align (character): horizontal alignment column.

title: Set link formatter — set_formatter_link
code: data <- data.frame(   label = c("This is a link", "This is another link"),   link = c("https://eoda.de", "https://eoda.de/data-science"),   link2 = c("eoda.de", "github.com"),   link3 = c("guinan", "data-science") )  js_func <- "(cell) => `https://eoda.de/${cell.getValue()}`"  tabulator(data) |>   set_formatter_link("link", label_field = "label") |>   set_formatter_link("link2", url_prefix = "https://") |>   set_formatter_link("link3", url = htmlwidgets::JS(js_func), label_field = "label")  {"x":{"data":{"label":["This is a link","This is another link"],"link":["https://eoda.de","https://eoda.de/data-science"],"link2":["eoda.de","github.com"],"link3":["guinan","data-science"],"id":[1,2]},"options":{"height":"311px","history":false,"layout":"fitColumns","responsiveLayout":false,"movableColumns":false,"headerVisible":true,"addRowPos":"bottom","movableRows":false,"resizableRows":false,"index":"id","groupStartOpen":true,"editTriggerEvent":"dblclick","selectableRows":"highlight","pagination":false,"paginationSize":10,"paginationSizeSelector":false,"paginationAddRow":"page","spreadsheet":false,"columns":[{"title":"label","field":"label","hozAlign":"left"},{"title":"link","field":"link","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"link","formatterParams":{"labelField":"label","target":"_blank"}},{"title":"link2","field":"link2","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"link","formatterParams":{"urlPrefix":"https://","target":"_blank"}},{"title":"link3","field":"link3","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"link","formatterParams":{"labelField":"label","url":"(cell) => `https://eoda.de/${cell.getValue()}`","target":"_blank"}}]},"stylesheetText":null},"evals":["options.columns.3.formatterParams.url"],"jsHooks":[]}

title: Set money formatter — set_formatter_money
code: set_formatter_money(   widget,   column,   decimal = c(",", "."),   thousand = c(".", ","),   symbol = "$",   symbol_after = "p",   negative_sign = "-",   precision = FALSE,   hoz_align = "left" )

title: Set money formatter — set_formatter_money
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column name column formatter applied . decimal (character): Symbol represent decimal point. thousand (character, bool): Symbol represent thousands separator. Set FALSE disable separator. symbol (character): currency symbol. symbol_after (bool): Whether put symbol number. negative_sign (character, bool): sign show front number. Set TRUE causes negative numbers enclosed brackets (123.45), standard style negative numbers accounting. precision (integer, bool): number decimals display. Set FALSE display decimals provided. hoz_align (character): horizontal alignment column.

title: Set money formatter — set_formatter_money
code: data <- data.frame(   Account_Number = c(     123456,     345667,     234567,     234566   ),   Account_Balance = c(100, -50, 200.30, -21.5) )  tabulator(data) |>   set_formatter_money(     "Account_Balance",     symbol = "\U20AC",     symbol_after = FALSE,     hoz_align = "right"   )  {"x":{"data":{"Account_Number":[123456,345667,234567,234566],"Account_Balance":[100,-50,200.3,-21.5],"id":[1,2,3,4]},"options":{"height":"311px","history":false,"layout":"fitColumns","responsiveLayout":false,"movableColumns":false,"headerVisible":true,"addRowPos":"bottom","movableRows":false,"resizableRows":false,"index":"id","groupStartOpen":true,"editTriggerEvent":"dblclick","selectableRows":"highlight","pagination":false,"paginationSize":10,"paginationSizeSelector":false,"paginationAddRow":"page","spreadsheet":false,"columns":[{"title":"Account_Number","field":"Account_Number","hozAlign":"right"},{"title":"Account_Balance","field":"Account_Balance","hozAlign":"right","formatter":"money","formatterParams":{"decimal":",","thousand":".","symbol":"€","symbolAfter":false,"negativeSign":"-","precision":false}}]},"stylesheetText":null},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

title: Set progress formatter — set_formatter_progress
code: set_formatter_progress(   widget,   column,   min = NA,   max = NA,   color = c("yellow", "orange", "red"),   legend = NA,   legend_color = "#000000",   legend_align = c("center", "left", "right", "justify"),   hoz_align = "left" )

title: Set progress formatter — set_formatter_progress
text: widget tabulator() HTML widget. column name column formatter applied . min (numeric): minimum value progress bar. set NA, minimum value column used. max (numeric): maximum value progress bar. set NA, maximum value column used. color (character): Either single color vector colors legend (character, TRUE, JavaScript function): set TRUE, value cell displayed. Set NA display value . Use JS pass JavaScript function legend. case, cell value passed function first argument. legend_color (character): text color legend. legend_align (character): text alignment legend. hoz_align (character): horizontal alignment column.

title: Set progress formatter — set_formatter_progress
code: data <- data.frame(   id = 1:6,   value = c(10, 0, 100, 20, 40, 60),   value2 = c(10, 0, 100, 20, 40, 60),   value3 = c(10, 0, 100, 20, 40, 60) )  js_func <- htmlwidgets::JS("(cellValue) => `${cellValue}%`")  tabulator(data) |>   set_formatter_progress("value") |>   set_formatter_progress("value2", legend = TRUE, legend_align = "left") |>   set_formatter_progress("value3", legend = js_func, legend_align = "right")  {"x":{"data":{"id":[1,2,3,4,5,6],"value":[10,0,100,20,40,60],"value2":[10,0,100,20,40,60],"value3":[10,0,100,20,40,60]},"options":{"height":"311px","history":false,"layout":"fitColumns","responsiveLayout":false,"movableColumns":false,"headerVisible":true,"addRowPos":"bottom","movableRows":false,"resizableRows":false,"index":"id","groupStartOpen":true,"editTriggerEvent":"dblclick","selectableRows":"highlight","pagination":false,"paginationSize":10,"paginationSizeSelector":false,"paginationAddRow":"page","spreadsheet":false,"columns":[{"title":"id","field":"id","hozAlign":"right"},{"title":"value","field":"value","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"progress","formatterParams":{"min":0,"max":100,"color":["yellow","orange","red"],"legend":null,"legendColor":"#000000","legendAlign":"center"}},{"title":"value2","field":"value2","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"progress","formatterParams":{"min":0,"max":100,"color":["yellow","orange","red"],"legend":true,"legendColor":"#000000","legendAlign":"left"}},{"title":"value3","field":"value3","hozAlign":"left","formatter":"progress","formatterParams":{"min":0,"max":100,"color":["yellow","orange","red"],"legend":"(cellValue) => `${cellValue}%`","legendColor":"#000000","legendAlign":"right"}}]},"stylesheetText":null},"evals":["options.columns.3.formatterParams.legend"],"jsHooks":[]}

code: setup <- tabulator_options(   spreadsheet = TRUE,   spreadsheet_sheets = list(     spreadsheet_def(       title = "First",       data = list(c(1, 2, 3))     ),     spreadsheet_def(       title = "Second",       data = list(c(4, 5, 6))     )   ),   spreadsheet_sheet_tabs = TRUE )  tabulator(data = NULL, setup, theme = "midnight")  {"x":{"data":null,"options":{"rowHeader":{"field":"_id","hozAlign":"center","headerSort":false,"frozen":true},"spreadsheetColumnDefinition":{"editor":"input"},"height":"311px","history":false,"layout":"fitColumns","responsiveLayout":false,"movableColumns":false,"headerVisible":true,"addRowPos":"bottom","movableRows":false,"resizableRows":false,"index":"id","groupStartOpen":true,"editTriggerEvent":"dblclick","selectableRows":"highlight","pagination":false,"paginationSize":10,"paginationSizeSelector":false,"paginationAddRow":"page","spreadsheet":true,"spreadsheetSheets":[{"title":"First","data":[[1,2,3]]},{"title":"Second","data":[[4,5,6]]}],"spreadsheetSheetTabs":true},"stylesheetText":null},"evals":[],"jsHooks":[]}

HTML widget to work with tabular data — tabulator
code: tabulator(   data,   options = tabulator_options(),   editable = FALSE,   luxon = FALSE,   sheetjs = FALSE,   theme = c("default", "midnight", "modern", "simple", "site", "bootstrap3",     "bootstrap4", "bootstrap5", "bulma", "materialize", "semanticui"),   col_select = NULL,   width = NULL,   height = NULL,   element_id = NULL,   ... )

title: HTML widget to work with tabular data — tabulator
text: data (data.frame, character list): spreadsheet mode data needs list NULL empty spreadsheet. options List setup options. Defaults tabulator_options(). editable Whether table editable. luxon Whether add luxon HTML dependency, required set_formatter_datetime(). sheetjs Whether add sheetjs HTML dependency, required trigger_download() support downloads xlsx files. theme Name theme applied table. col_select Passed readr::read_csv() data file name. width, height Output size. element_id Unique ID widget element. ... Named arguments appended options parameter.

what: Setup options for tabulator() HTML widget — tabulator_options
title: Setup options for tabulator() HTML widget — tabulator_options
Setup options for tabulator() HTML widget — tabulator_options
code: tabulator_options(   height = "311px",   history = FALSE,   columns = NULL,   layout = c("fitColumns", "fitData", "fitDataFill", "fitDataStretch", "fitDataTable"),   responsive_layout = FALSE,   movable_columns = FALSE,   header_visible = TRUE,   row_height = NULL,   add_row_pos = c("bottom", "top"),   movable_rows = FALSE,   resizable_rows = FALSE,   frozen_rows = NULL,   index = "id",   group_by = NULL,   group_start_open = TRUE,   group_toggle_element = NULL,   edit_trigger_event = c("dblclick", "click", "focus"),   selectable_rows = "highlight",   pagination = FALSE,   pagination_size = 10,   pagination_size_selector = FALSE,   pagination_add_row = c("page", "table"),   spreadsheet = FALSE,   spreadsheet_rows = NULL,   spreadsheet_columns = NULL,   spreadsheet_column_definition = NULL,   spreadsheet_sheets = NULL,   spreadsheet_sheet_tabs = NULL,   ... )

title: Setup options for tabulator() HTML widget — tabulator_options
text: height (character) height table pixels. history (bool): Enable user interaction history functionality. columns (list): Column definitions. set NULL, definitions auto generated table data. layout (character): Layout mode table columns. responsive_layout (bool): Automatically hide show columns fit width Tabulator element. movable_columns (bool): Allow users move reorder rows. header_visible (bool): Whether header visible. row_height (numeric): fixed height rows. add_row_pos (character): table position new rows added. movable_rows (bool): Allow users move reorder rows. resizable_rows (bool): Allow user resize rows. frozen_rows (numeric): Number frozen rows. index (character): Field used unique index row. group_by (character vector): Field group rows . Pass multiple values multi level grouping. group_start_open (bool vector): Open state groups grouping enabled. length vector depends number levels set group_by. group_toggle_element (character, bool): One arrow header. Set FALSE disable toggling . edit_trigger_event (character): Event triggers cell edit. selectable_rows (character, bool, integer) Set FALSE disble row selection. set TRUE, can select many rows want. set "highlight", rows just highlighted change state clicked. integer value sets maximum number rows can selected. pagination (bool): Whether enable pagination. pagination_size (integer): Number rows page. pagination_size_selector (list): Add pagination size selector. pagination_add_row (character): add rows table pagination enabled. spreadsheet (bool): Whether enable spreadsheet mode. spreadsheet_rows (integer): Number spreadsheet rows. spreadsheet_columns (integer): Number spreadsheet columns. spreadsheet_column_definition Column definition used columns sheet. spreadsheet_sheets (list): List sheet definitions. spreadsheet_sheet_tabs (bool): Whether show sheet tabs footer. ... options.

title: Setup options for tabulator() HTML widget — tabulator_options
text: list setup options used options parameter tabulator()
